```{r}
library(shiny)

# Define the UI for the Shiny app
ui <- fluidPage(
  titlePanel("US Arrests Bar Charts"),
  
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      selectInput("variable", "Select Variable:",
                  choices = c("Murder", "Assault", "UrbanPop")),
      br(),
      p("Select a variable to be plotted in the bar chart.")
    ),
    
    mainPanel(
      plotOutput("barplot")
    )
  )
)

# Define the server logic for the Shiny app
server <- function(input, output) {
  # Default color
  default_color <- "steelblue"
  
  # Create a bar plot based on the selected variable and the default color
  output$barplot <- renderPlot({
    data_variable <- switch(input$variable,
                            "Murder" = USArrests$Murder,
                            "Assault" = USArrests$Assault,
                            "UrbanPop" = USArrests$UrbanPop
    )
    
    bar_colors <- rep(default_color, length(data_variable))  # Use the default color
    barplot(data_variable, names.arg = rownames(USArrests), col = bar_colors)
  })
}

# Run the Shiny app
shinyApp(ui, server)
---
```
